# criteria.maximin { #pyLHD.criteria.maximin }

`criteria.maximin(arr)`

Compute the maximin criterion for a given design. A higher value corresponds to a more regular scattering of design points.

## Parameters

| Name   | Type          | Description                                                                                        | Default    |
|--------|---------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `arr`  | numpy.ndarray | A design matrix. If design matrix is not within [0,1], the origianl design will be scaled to [0,1] | _required_ |

## Returns

| Type   | Description                  |
|--------|------------------------------|
| float  | Calculated maximin criterion |

## Examples



```{python}
import pyLHD
random_lhd = pyLHD.rLHD(n_rows=5,n_columns=5)
pyLHD.maximin(random_lhd)
```
